step1_initial_points.title: Limited Visibility of AI Market Landscape
step1_initial_points.description: DPC lacks comprehensive knowledge of available AI tools. They need to gather market intelligence to build a "catalogue of offerings" that will inform future project planning, procurement strategies, and policy development.

step1_initial_points.title: Operational Efficiency and Decision Support
step1_initial_points.description: Government agencies face pressure to "boost efficiency, inform decision-making, and drive innovation." DPC seeks technologies to improve service delivery and increase public satisfaction to achieve better community outcomes.

step1_initial_points.title: Data Security and Regulatory Compliance
step1_initial_points.description: AI tools must comply with strict "ICT, Security and Cyber policies" and "South Australian Information Privacy Principles." DPC requires robust measures to safeguard government data, particularly when using third-party LLMs.

step1_initial_points.title: Integration with Legacy Government Systems
step1_initial_points.description: Solutions must prove their "adaptability... for integration into existing government systems." DPC needs to understand technical requirements to ensure seamless operation with current infrastructure and platforms.

step1_initial_points.title: Budgeting and Cost Model Uncertainty
step1_initial_points.description: DPC lacks pricing clarity for AI adoption. They require "indicative costing models and pricing structures" to enable accurate future procurement planning, budget allocation, and total cost estimation.

step1_initial_points.title: Data Privacy and Sensitive Info Protection
step1_initial_points.description: There is significant concern regarding data handling. DPC needs to understand "data privacy, data usage policies" and specific measures taken to protect sensitive information from unauthorized access or misuse.

step1_initial_points.title: Validating Solution Maturity and Risk
step1_initial_points.description: To mitigate deployment risks, DPC needs to assess the "maturity, scalability, and adaptability" of solutions. They require evidence of "performance history in environment similar to DPC" and successful government deployments.

step1_initial_points.title: Workforce Capability and Training Gaps
step1_initial_points.description: Successful AI adoption requires an enabled workforce. DPC identifies a need to understand "Staff and tool training needed" and support arrangements to bridge technical and operational capability gaps.

step1_initial_points.title: AI Policy and Governance Development
step1_initial_points.description: DPC is currently shaping its AI policies (e.g., Guideline 13.1). They need industry insights to "inform... policy development," ensuring that internal governance evolves effectively alongside emerging technologies.

pain_points_final.title: Data Security & Regulatory Compliance
pain_points_final.description: Strict adherence to ICT Security policies and Privacy Principles is mandatory. The risk of data leakage via third-party LLMs or unauthorized access to sensitive government information threatens public trust and violates non-negotiable regulatory standards.

pain_points_final.title: Operational Efficiency & Service Delivery
pain_points_final.description: Agencies face pressure to boost efficiency and innovation without increasing headcount. Manual workflows slow decision-making. DPC requires technologies that demonstrably improve community outcomes and public satisfaction through enhanced service delivery.

pain_points_final.title: Proven Solution Maturity & Scalability
pain_points_final.description: DPC cannot risk deploying unproven technology. To mitigate deployment failure, solutions must provide evidence of stability, scalability, and successful performance history in environments similar to DPC, validating their readiness for government use.

pain_points_final.title: Seamless Legacy System Integration
pain_points_final.description: New AI tools must not create data silos. The inability to integrate seamlessly with existing legacy government infrastructure and platforms creates technical debt and operational friction, making technical adaptability a critical requirement.

pain_points_final.title: Workforce Capability & Skill Bridging
pain_points_final.description: Successful AI adoption is limited by current workforce gaps. DPC identifies a critical need for comprehensive training and support arrangements to bridge technical capabilities, ensuring staff can effectively utilize and manage new tools.
